page01_text:
Panel 1.1
Narration: “In 1808, war broke out between Sweden and Russia. The struggle for Finland had begun.”
Narration: “Villages burned, armies marched through snow and forest. What was once Swedish Finland stood alone against the Empire of the Tsar.”
Narration: “This is the story of courage and defiance — at Jutas.”
Quote: “Själf var han kommen till Nykarleby.”
page02_text:
Panel 2.1
Narration: “September 13, 1808. The small village of Jutas near Nykarleby becomes the stage for a decisive encounter.”
Quote: “I sträcktåg nyss hans skaror norrut ilat.”

Panel 2.2
Narration: “Swedish-Finnish forces, under Colonel Cronstedt, await the Russians advancing from the south.”
Quote: “En dyster stillhet rådde undertiden.”

Panel 2.3
Messenger (speech bubble): “Von Döbeln is coming — but he is ill!”
Quote: “Lyss, hör, ni hör kanonerna vid Jutas;”
page03_text:
Panel 3.1
Narration: “In a modest house in Nykarleby, the commander lies ill but unyielding.”
Quote: “Han tycktes lyssna, vänta, ängsligt bida.”

Panel 3.2
Narration: “Major General Georg Carl von Döbeln — feverish, wounded, yet commanding.”
Quote: “Hans barm sågs kämpa, ögat brann i lågor.”

Panel 3.3
Von Döbeln (speech bubble): “I may lie sick — but my place is in battle.”
Quote: “Jag vill, jag skall bli frisk, det får ej prutas,”

Panel 3.4
Von Döbeln (speech bubble): “We strike first. The Russians must not gain the upper hand.”
Narration: “His will alone carried the army forward.”
Quote: “Han bjuder tystnad. Hör hans röst! Han ropar”
page04_text:
Panel 4.1
Narration: “Jutas — a quiet settlement, soon to echo with musket fire.”
Quote: “Vid Jutas hade skotten tystnat alla,”

Panel 4.2
Narration: “Cronstedt’s men secure their ground, while Döbeln’s detachment moves to outflank.”
Quote: “I täta rader blixtra ren gevären,”

Panel 4.3
Russian officer (speech bubble): “Advance! Push them back!”
Narration: “The enemy had twice their number.”
Quote: “Och Kosatschoffski ordnade sin skara, beredd att allt förkrossa med ett nytt.”
page05_text:
Panel 5.1
Narration: “At noon, the first volleys burst. The air thick with powder.”
Quote: “I täta rader blixtra ren gevären,”

Panel 5.2
Von Döbeln (speech bubble): “Forward! For Finland and for honor!”
Quote: “Den lilla mannen syns med band om pannan,”

Panel 5.3
Narration: “They met the Russians head-on — steel against steel.”
Quote: “Skrik ni som Armfelt: marsch, framåt, rör trumman!”

Panel 5.4
Narration: “A fallen standard-bearer replaced instantly by another.”
Quote: “Och det blir skick på nytt från led till led.”
page06_text:
Panel 6.1
Narration: “The Russian left flank falters. Döbeln sees the moment.”
Von Döbeln (speech bubble): “Now — drive them back!”
Quote: “Han rider fram, de sluta sig hans hopar,”

Panel 6.2
Narration: “Finnish troops rush forward with bayonets.”
Quote: “Framåt, framåt till seger eller död!”

Panel 6.3
Narration: “By dusk, Jutas was theirs. The victory saved the army’s retreat toward Vasa.”
Quote: “En annan ande hvilar öfver den.”
page07_text:
Panel 7.1
Narration: “Night fell over Jutas. The victory was costly.”
Quote: “Sen döden gjort der ren sin första skörd.”

Panel 7.2
Von Döbeln (speech bubble): “They fought like lions. Finland will remember.”
Narration: “The sick general had led one of the last Swedish victories of the war.”
Quote: “Och upp han sprang, fast svigtande och svag:”
page08_text:
Panel 8.1
Narration: “Over two centuries later — the story lives on.”
Quote: “O fosterland, hvem spanar dina öden?”

Panel 8.2
Teacher (speech bubble): “At Jutas, courage outweighed strength. That is why we still speak of Döbeln.”
Quote: “Alen hur du jublar då, men hur du klagar,”

Panel 8.3
Inscription (text box): “Slaget vid Jutas — 13 september 1808.”
Narration: “A hero remembered beyond his time.”
Quote: “Du minnas denna, minnas Döbelns dag.”
